page.title: 04THE WIGAN PIER COMPLEX #3
page.content: Approximately 400 metres along the Canal Bank is the{Trencherfield Cotton {Mill}built in 1908. This was a cotton- spinning mill, one of several in the Wigan area. The main feature of the mill is the{steam engine}that powered all the machinery within the mill. The mill engine was built in Bolton by J & E Wood Ltd., and it gives 2100 horse power. The boiler operates at a pressure of 200 pounds per square inch and the huge 25 foot diameter flywheel rotates at 65 revolutions per minute. The Metropolitan Borough of Wigan have spent a lot of money on the renovation of the Trencherfield Mill site. They have refurbished the mill engine room and restored the engine so that it is now the only working engine of its kind in England as well as being the largest working mill steam engine in the world.
